resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
liyafan82 commented on pull request #6120: ARROW-7491: [Java] Improve the performance of aligning
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6120
 
 
   Aligning is an important and frequent operation when writing IPC data. It writes no more than 7 0 bytes to the output.
   The current implementation creates a new byte array each time, leading to performance overhead, and increases the GC pressure.
   
   We improve it by means of a shared byte array. Benchmark evaluation shows a 10% performance gain.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

   Benchmark                             (alignSize)  Mode  Cnt    Score   Error  Units
   WriteChannelBenchmark.alignBenchmark            1  avgt    5  139.916 ± 0.721  ns/op

   WriteChannelBenchmark.alignBenchmark            6  avgt    5  159.414 ± 1.750  ns/op

   after:

   WriteChannelBenchmark.alignBenchmark            2  avgt    5  123.116 ± 0.970  ns/op

fsaintjacques commented on issue #6120: ARROW-7491: [Java] Improve the performance of aligning
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6120#issuecomment-571188046
 
 
   This change is pointless if `align` is not called often in an IPC stream. OTOH, you found a legitimate issue in writeZeroes, I'd fix the `writeZeros` function with a static constant buffer (like you did) and a loop instead. Otherwise one might have surprise if it's called with say `writeZeroes(2^31)`.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

liyafan82 commented on issue #6120: ARROW-7491: [Java] Improve the performance of aligning
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6120#issuecomment-571399721
 
 
   > This change is pointless if `align` is not called often in an IPC stream. OTOH, you found a legitimate issue in writeZeroes, I'd fix the `writeZeros` function with a static constant buffer (like you did) and a loop instead. Otherwise one might have surprise if it's called with say `writeZeroes(2^31)`.
   
   @fsaintjacques Thanks a lot for you feedback.
   
   The number of calls to `align` depends on the distribution of the size for each write operation. If the write size is uniformly distributed, there is a 7/8 probability that the `align` method will be called. 
   
   In practice, I found the data buffer size is often rounded to a multiple of 8, but the validity buffer is often not (Maybe this problem will be changed in the future).
   
   I am not sure how often is the `writeZeros` method called. So if you think it is important, maybe you can open an issue to track it. And please note that we can only use a constant array, not a constant buffer, because a buffer can only be consumed once (We can reuse the buffer after calling the `rewind` method, but this will lead to problems in multi-threading scenarios). 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on issue #6120: ARROW-7491: [Java] Improve the performance of aligning
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6120#issuecomment-571572028
 
 
   What I'm suggesting is that you preserve the current implementation of align to call writeZeros and fix writeZeros to not allocate a byte array.
   
   Not because this will improve `align` speed, but because writeZeros is O(n) memory when it could be O(1).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

   > What I'm suggesting is that you preserve the current implementation of align to call writeZeros and fix writeZeros to not allocate a byte array.
   > 
   > Not because this will improve `align` speed, but because writeZeros is O(n) memory when it could be O(1).

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Aligning is an important and frequent operation when writing IPC data. It writes no more than 7 0 bytes to the output. 
The current implementation creates a new byte array each time, leading to performance overhead, and increases the GC pressure. 

We improve it by means of a shared byte array. Benchmark evaluation shows a 11% performance gain.
